verb.description: Present or constitute (a problem, danger, or difficulty)
examples: the sheer number of visitors is posing a threat to the area

verb.description: Assume a particular attitude or position in order to be photographed, painted, or drawn.
examples: she posed for a swarm of TV cameramen
a literary novel posing as a spy thriller
a detective posing as a customer

verb.description: Behave affectedly in order to impress others.
examples: some people like to drive these cars, but most just like to pose in them

noun.description: A particular way of standing or sitting, usually adopted for effect or in order to be photographed, painted, or drawn.
examples: photographs of boxers in ferocious poses

noun.description: A particular way of behaving adopted in order to give others a false impression or to impress others.
examples: the man dropped his pose of amiability

origin: Early 16th century: shortening of obsolete appose, from Old French aposer, variant of oposer oppose.
